name: VA Main Street Health Clinic
shortDescription: General medical services, mental health support, and specialist referrals for veterans.
description: The VA Main Street Health Clinic offers comprehensive primary care, mental health services, and access to a network of specialists. We are dedicated to providing high-quality healthcare to eligible veterans in a supportive environment.
eligibility: Eligible veterans. Check VA website for details.
applicationProcess: Enroll for VA healthcare benefits online or in person.

name: VetTech Future Program
shortDescription: Intensive training programs in software development, cybersecurity, and IT support for veterans.
description: VetTech Future Program provides cutting-edge technology training to help veterans transition into high-demand tech careers. Courses are offered both online and in-person, with career placement assistance.
eligibility: Veterans and transitioning service members. Some programs may have prerequisites.
applicationProcess: Apply online via our website. GI Bill benefits accepted.

name: Heroes Work Initiative
shortDescription: Connects veterans with employers committed to hiring military talent. Resume workshops and interview coaching.
description: The Heroes Work Initiative is a non-profit dedicated to assisting veterans in finding meaningful employment. We offer resume building, interview preparation, networking events, and direct connections to veteran-friendly companies.

name: Veterans Home Base
shortDescription: Assistance with finding affordable housing, emergency shelters, and resources for homeless veterans.
description: Veterans Home Base provides support for veterans facing housing insecurity. We offer resources for finding affordable permanent housing, temporary emergency shelter, and connections to programs aimed at preventing veteran homelessness.
eligibility: Veterans, with a focus on those at risk of or experiencing homelessness.
applicationProcess: Contact our hotline or visit a local office for an assessment.

name: Veterans Legal Aid Society
shortDescription: Free legal services for veterans on issues like benefits appeals, housing disputes, and family law.
description: The Veterans Legal Aid Society offers pro bono legal assistance to veterans facing a variety of civil legal challenges. Our team of attorneys and paralegals can help with VA benefits claims, landlord-tenant issues, child support, and more.

address.details: Services offered statewide via phone and virtual consultations. Limited in-person appointments.

eligibility: Low-income veterans with qualifying legal issues.
operatingHours: Intake line open Mon, Wed, Fri, 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM
